Wikipedia contains 5,962,986 pages.
There are a total of 482,396,606 links between Wikipedia pages.
8,896,657 Wikipedia pages are actually just redirects to other pages.
"Index of Singapore-related articles" is the Wikipedia page with the highest number of outgoing links (10,446).
"List of people from Illinois" is the Wikipedia page with the second highest number of outgoing links (8,093).
"List of least concern birds" is the Wikipedia page with the third highest number of outgoing links (7,896).
"List of U.S. state legislators" is the Wikipedia page with the fourth highest number of outgoing links (7,477).
"List of film director and actor collaborations" is the Wikipedia page with the fifth highest number of outgoing links (6,620).
"Geographic coordinate system" is the most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,102,441 incoming links).
"International Standard Book Number" is the second most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,099,997 incoming links).
"WorldCat" is the third most linked to page on Wikipedia (575,007 incoming links).
"Virtual International Authority File" is the fourth most linked to page on Wikipedia (548,633 incoming links).
"United States" is the fifth most linked to page on Wikipedia (479,696 incoming links).

326 Wikipedia pages (0.006% of all pages) have no incoming or outgoing links.
There are only 1,319 Wikipedia pages (0.02% of all pages) which link to no other pages.
There are 313,768 Wikipedia pages (5.35% of all pages) which are not linked to from any other page.

The "List of lists of lists" page is a list of pages that are lists of list pages on the English Wikipedia.
The "Order of magnitude" page lists "yocto-" (10^-24) and "yotta-" (10^24) as the smallest and largest magnitude prefixes.
The "Names of large numbers" page contains words like "googol" (10^100) and "millinillion" (10^3003).
An "Illegal prime" is a prime number that represents information whose possession or distribution is forbidden in some legal jurisdictions.
